Award.AwardTitle: Conference: Annual Spring Institute on Noncommutative Geometry and Operator Algebras; University of Bonn, Germany; May 17-25, 2016
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding to help defray the expenses of US participants in the "Annual Spring Institute on Noncommutative Geometry and Operator Algebras (NCGOA) 2016" that will be held from May 17-25, 2016, on the campus of the University of Bonn, Germany.

This event is the fourteenth installment of the Vanderbilt Noncommutative Geometry and Operator Algebra (NCGOA) spring conferences, a series that each year brings together a diverse group of roughly one hundred mathematicians whose primary research interests are in operator algebras and related topics. The main foci of the 2016 event, which will not be held in Nashville but will be integrated into a trimester program on von Neumann algebras at the Hausdorff Institute in Bonn, are deformation/rigidity theory, free probability theory, and subfactors. The conference program provides ample opportunity for graduate students, postdocs, and other young scientists to present their work. More details can be found at the conference website: http://www.him.uni-bonn.de/ncgoa2016/.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This conference award supported US based mathematicians to participate in the annual Spring Institute on Noncommutative Geometry and Operator Algebras (NCGOA 2016) at the University of Bonn, Germany, May 17-25, 2016. More than 110 mathematicians attended NCGOA 2016 and roughly 70% of them were PhD students and postdoctoral scholars.The topic of NCGOA 2016 was "Von Neumann algebras: deformation/rigidity, free probability and subfactors". Mini-courses were given by the following experts and leaders in von Neumann algebras. Remi Boutonnet (Université de Bordeaux), Adrian Ioana (UCSD), Masaki Izumi (University of Kyoto), Emily Peters (Loyola University Chicago), Dima Shlyakhtenko (UCLA), Stefaan Vaes (KU Leuven) and Dan Voiculescu (UC Berkeley). In addition, 19 invited speakers presented their work and answered questions by the attendees.

This NSF award provided roughly 57% of the funding for this conference/school. The remainder was provided by the Hausdorff Research Institut for Mathematics (Bonn, Germany) as part of the trimester program on von Neumann algebras, and Vanderbilt University.

This was the 14th edition of the annual spring institute on Noncommutative Geometry and Operator Algebras, a highly successful conference/spring school whose goal it is to lead PhD students and postdoctoral scholars to the research frontier in various topics of NCG & OA. Moreover, opportunities to discuss research projects with senior mathematiciens are provided.

For more information about NCGOA 2016, see https://www.him.uni-bonn.de/ncgoa2016/. Recorded talks can be found at https://mediaserver.uni-bonn.de/channels/#ncgoa-2016.
